target_description.comment: Periodical literature (also called a periodical publication or simply a periodical) is a published work that appears in a new edition on a regular schedule. Other examples would be a newsletter, a literary journal or learned journal, or a yearbook.

The monastery generally includes a place reserved for prayer which may be a chapel, church or temple, and may also serve as an oratory.

target_description.comment: An underground journal is, although over time there have always been publications forbidden by law, a phenomenon typical of countries occupied by the Germans during the Second World War. The writing in the underground press aims at stiffening a spirit of resistance against Nazi occupation. The distribution of underground journals had to be very secretive and was, therefore, very much dependant on illegal distribution circuits and the hazards of persecution by the occupant.
target_description.label: underground journal

references_description.comment: a settlement ranging from a few hundred to several thousand (occasionally hundreds of thousands). Usually, a town is thought of as larger than a village but smaller than a city, though there are exceptions to this rule.
references_description.label: town
